attributes.action: immediately prosecute those party officials and civil servants who were involved in the recently reported destruction of all expense receipts submitted by Tony Blair.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Tony Blair left office just a year ago, therefore destruction of receipts submitted by him in the 3 years prior to his departure was illegal (and was probably ordered by party officials to ensure his protection from prosecution) and somebody has to be held to account, in the same way as I or any other non-politician in this country would be for not keeping records for the required 7 years.

rejection.details: Government cannot prosecute individuals or organisations. It is the role of the police to investigate suspected crimes, and the role of the Crown Prosecution Service to decide whether there is a case to answer, and to prosecute.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
